meaningMnemonic: You plant your <radical>flowers</radical> in the light of the <radical>sun</radical> in the shape of a <radical>cross</radical>, but it's too hot—the sun is too strong—and you end up with <kanji>grass</kanji>. Flowers can't grow in these conditions.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>grass</kanji> on top is brown and burned from the sun, so you need to take a <reading>cool saw</reading> (くさ) and hack the tops off. The saw is actually physically cool to the touch, to help heal the grass' sunburned bits. It just happens to look cool too.
